Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup, probably of type B; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: reserved band at rim; below, red-figure decoration consisting of back of head of youth, facing left or frontal, wearing added red wreath; at lower right corner of sherd, letter A in red.
Curator's comments: All publications after BM Cat.Vases III (including Merlin) that refer to British Museum 1888,0601.611c (E134.4) are referring to a sherd from a different cup on which this registration number has been written, but whose real number is at this time unknown. For a similar frontal face, see the cup Louvre G 13 by the Pedieus Painter (Korshak, Y., Frontal faces in Attic vase painting of the archaic period. Chicago 1987, 95, fig. 22). See also the tondo of the cup Louvre G 291 by Onesimos (Korshak 1987, 113, fig 47) and Copenhagen, NM 3880 by the Dokimasia Painter (Korshak 1987, 98, fig 26).
The wreath seems a little askew for a frontal head.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E134.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0656) (Phase 1)
